staffmember.name: Wayne Beaton
staffmember.title: Eclipse Evangelist
staffmember.description: Wayne is the Director of Open Source Projects at the Eclipse Foundation. He spends his days working with the many Eclipse projects, learning about Eclipse technology, and making sure that everybody knows just how cool it all really is. Wayne is also the editor-in-chief of Eclipse Corner, PMC member of the Mylyn, Technology, and TPTP Projects, Project Lead for the Dash, Examples, and Woolsey Projects, and an advisor for osbootcamp. In 1982, he received the prestigious Chief Scouts Award from then-Governor General Edward Schreyer. In 1984 his team was selected to represent beautiful British Columbia in the Kinsmen Voyageur Relay. In his spare time, he writes down meaningless accomplishments from his youth in a lame attempt to impress the reader.

staffmember.name: Janet Campbell
staffmember.title: Director, Intellectual Property
staffmember.description: Outside of work, Janet enjoys traveling (to South East Asia in particular), walking her dogs, taking her bike for a spin and spending time with family and friends.

staffmember.name: Sharon Corbett-GÃ¼tz
staffmember.title: Intellectual Property Management
staffmember.description: When remote from Eclipse, Sharon C. is a fulltime soccer mom and dedicated footie fan. Sharon can usually be found heading out with her son to a practice, game or tournament.

staffmember.name: Nathan Gervais
staffmember.title: Web Developer
staffmember.description: Keep an eye out for this kid! Nathan joined Eclipse in 2006 and is usually seen lurking around eclipse.org websites working his magic. Hobbies include playing tennis, walking his dog, and working on whatever his latest project is!

staffmember.name: Anne Jacko
staffmember.title: Conference Queen
staffmember.description: When not in front of a monitor, Anne prefers activities that involve wearing a helmet--horseback riding, skiing, and cycling. One of her favorite books is The Chicago Manual of Style, so if you need help with the nitpicking details of writing in English, she's happy to help.

staffmember.name: Allison Kelly
staffmember.title: Ecosystem Development Support
staffmember.description: Allison joined the Eclipse Foundation in March 2009. Her focus is on membership retention and supporting business development. Outside of work she enjoys cooking, traveling, spending time with family and friends and dreams of living in a warmer climate someday!

staffmember.name: Perri Lavergne
staffmember.title: Ecosystem Development Support
staffmember.description: Perri joined the Eclipse Foundation in May 2010. Her focus is on membership retention and development. Outside of work Perri enjoys spending time with family and friends, medical research, volunteer work for organizations dealing with children with special needs, running, cooking and baking. Perri hopes to one day accomplish her long time dream of a unique before and after school program for teens with special needs.

staffmember.name: Mike Milinkovich
staffmember.title: Executive Director
staffmember.description:
Outside of work, Mike's passions are his family, the family cottage and hockey (as a coach, player and fan) in pretty much that order. When he's not working, or traveling for work, you will probably find him involved in one of those three things.

You can read Mike's blog at http://dev.eclipse.org/blogs/mike/.

staffmember.name: Ralph Mueller
staffmember.title: Director, Ecosystem - Europe
staffmember.description:
Ralph's role at the Eclipse Foundation is focused on growing the Eclipse Ecosystem across Europe.

Ralph's passion outside of work is golf, both as a player and as a coach for children just starting the game. He's also helped both Mike and Donald to improve their games.

staffmember.name: Denis Roy
staffmember.title: Director, IT Services
staffmember.description:
In the office, Denis spends his time in front of a Linux command prompt. Leisure activities include going to the cottage with my daughter, drag racing and snowmobiling.

You can read his blog, and view the Eclipse Webmaster page.

staffmember.name: Ian Skerrett
staffmember.title: Director, Marketing
staffmember.description: Ian takes care of the marketing activities at the Eclipse Foundation. Although our community is the Eclipse marketing machine, Ian supports the projects and member companies to increase the awareness of all the cool stuff happening at Eclipse. You can read his blog at http://ianskerrett.wordpress.com/.

staffmember.name: Donald Smith
staffmember.title: Director, Ecosystem Development
staffmember.description:
After a very busy 2005 completing an MBA, designing a new house and getting married, Donald joined Eclipse to begin 2006 with his now seemingly infinite free time. Donald has over a decade of experience with enterprise software including product management, marketing, engineering and consulting. He has spoken on various topics at most major Java conferences including Java One, TSSS, JAOO, CSS, Sun Tech Days and others. Donald's role at Eclipse is to help foster the development of the ecosystem.
 
You can read Donald's blog at http://eclipse-ecosystem.blogspot.com/.

staffmember.name: Matt Ward
staffmember.title: Systems Administrator
staffmember.description: Matt spends his time triaging the Webmaster inbox and putting out fires. If you can't take the heat, stay out of the data center.

staffmember.name: Sharon Wolfe
staffmember.title: Office Manager
staffmember.description: Sharon has been with the Eclipse Foundation since July 2004. In addition to her Office Manager responsibilities, Sharon assists with marketing activities and also organizes or assists with the planning of various meetings and conferences. Sharon thanks Mike every day for opening a proper office because she was going stir crazy working out of the home office in her basement!
